channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Planned tree planting obstruction, 20th January
item.description:
Planned tree planting on pathway kerb will cause a hazard of the highway. The road becomes narrow on the bend compared to other corners. Cars often need to use the kerb due to the narrow road. Planting tree in location will likely cause obstruction of vehicles passing. Especially emergency vehicles that already have trouble using the roundabout of cul de sac. On the opposite side.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Austen Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in hurst road after junction with with avenue road, 20th January
item.description:
A large deep pothole in the middle of the road has caused debris in the road and causing damage to cars passing over. The pothole also poses a significant risk to cyclists and pedestrians crossing the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Hurst Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Loose Drain Cover, 20th January
item.description:
This cover was reported loose and noisy and the council responded as being fixed, which it has not been. The cover is loose and noisy and a potential hazard to vehicles driving over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orpington Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Chesterfield Grove Flytipping of Christmas Trees, 20th January
item.description:
Along Chesterfield Grove and on the corner where the bikes are kept. Christmas trees have been dumped all along the pavements causing mess due to the shedding of sharp needles and dangerous obstruction of the pavement for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 56a Chesterfield Grove-Flytipping 2nd Complaint, 20th January
item.description:
2nd complaint: Flytipping has yet again occurred from here. Health and safety hazard where items can be blown down injuring pedestrians and also blocking the pavement. Multiple complaints of this conduct submitted but the flytipping keeps occurring, thus now reporting the number of times the complaints have been filed, highlighting the complete disregard of not adhering to law regarding fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
